text:
Fulton is a city in Bourbon County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 163 people lived there.
History.
Fulton was first known as Osaga, and it was created as Osaga in 1869. The name changed to Fulton in 1878, after the city of Fulton, Illinois.
A post office was created under the name Osaga in 1869.
Geography.
Fulton is at (38.009828, -94.719358), along the Little Osage River. The United States Census Bureau says taht the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
In 2010, there were 163 people, 63 households, and 45 families residing in the city. The population density was. 90.2% of the people were White, 0.6% were African American, 3.7% were Native American, 1.2% were from other races, and 4.3% were from two or more races. 5.5% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race.
2000 census.
In 2000, there were 184 people, 71 households, and 47 families residing in the city. The population density was 975.4 people per square mile (373.9/km²). 94.57% of the people were White, 3.26% were Native American, 0.54% were Asian, and 1.63% were from two or more races. 0.54% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race.
